name: irredentist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
supporting or relating to a policy of returning land to a country that it belonged to in the past: They asserted an irredentist claim on the territory. nationalist and irredentist forces
More examplesFewer examplesThe province has been at the centre of irredentist unrest.This is an irredentist attempt to extend their borders.People leave patriotic messages in Spanish that are full of irredentist sentiment. an irredentist border dispute between Latvia and Russia

someone who supports a policy of returning land to a country that it belonged to in the past: The people threw out the irredentist and elected a peacemaker.
More examplesFewer examplesThe term "irredentists" is commonly applied to Italians who, after 1870, sought "redemption" of Italian-speaking lands under Austrian rule.His coalition includes everything from western-style liberals to frothing-at-the-mouth irredentists.
